leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 医学影像-分割/检测/诊断生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 预处理→训练/推理→评测→部署
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 框架 + 标注/数据 + 部署

tools.name: DINOv2-3D-Med
tools.one_line_profile: 3D implementation of DINOv2 for self-supervised pretraining on medical images
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of DINOv2 adapted for 3D volumetric medical imaging, supporting self-supervised pretraining pipelines using Lightly and MONAI frameworks.

tools.name: pyradiomics
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for extraction of Radiomics features from medical images
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python package for the extraction of Radiomics features from 2D and 3D medical images and binary masks, widely used for quantitative image analysis.

tools.name: AlizaMS
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance DICOM viewer and medical image analyzer
tools.detailed_description: A DICOM viewer and medical image analysis tool written in C++, supporting 2D/3D visualization and basic measurement tasks.

tools.name: ecg-dicom-web-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based viewer for ECG files in DICOM format
tools.detailed_description: A TypeScript library and viewer for rendering Electrocardiogram (ECG) data stored in DICOM format directly in web browsers.

tools.name: pydicer
tools.one_line_profile: Python tool for converting DICOM data to analysis-ready formats
tools.detailed_description: A tool to streamline the conversion of DICOM data into formats suitable for research (like NIfTI) and analysis, handling RTStructs and other radiotherapy specific data.

tools.name: brkraw
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to access and convert raw Bruker Biospin MRI data
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python tool and library to access, read, and convert raw data from Bruker Biospin MRI scanners, facilitating integration into standard neuroimaging pipelines.

tools.name: OHIF-AI
tools.one_line_profile: OHIF DICOM Viewer integrated with server-side AI segmentation models
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the OHIF DICOM Web viewer that integrates server-side AI models (like SAM2, medSAM) for advanced interactive segmentation and annotation.

tools.name: SlicerAutomatedDentalTools
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for automated dental image analysis
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension providing automated tools for dental CBCT analysis, including segmentation and landmark detection.

tools.name: picai_prep
tools.one_line_profile: Preprocessing library for 3D prostate MRI data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for preprocessing 3D medical images (specifically MRI) for prostate cancer detection tasks, handling resampling and standardization.

tools.name: rse-grand-challenge-metrics
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for creating evaluation metrics for Grand Challenge competitions
tools.detailed_description: A library (evalutils) to assist in creating evaluation containers and metrics for medical imaging challenges hosted on grand-challenge.org.

tools.name: DICOMweb-js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript client for DICOM Web Services
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript client library for consuming DICOM Web Services (QIDO-RS, WADO-RS, STOW-RS), enabling web-based medical imaging applications.

tools.name: bidscoin
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for converting neuroimaging data to BIDS standard
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly tool to convert source-level neuroimaging data (DICOM/PAR) into the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS) standard, featuring a GUI and heuristics.

tools.name: pypx
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for PACS interaction
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper around DCMTK and PyDicom to facilitate interaction with PACS (Picture Archiving and Communication Systems) for querying and retrieving medical images.

tools.name: TotalSegmentator-AIDE
tools.one_line_profile: TotalSegmentator packaged as a MONAI Application Package
tools.detailed_description: A packaging of the TotalSegmentator tool into the MONAI Application Package (MAP) format, enabling easy deployment and execution of whole-body segmentation tasks.

tools.name: Asclepios-DICOM-Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source DICOM viewer based on Qt and VTK
tools.detailed_description: A desktop DICOM viewer application developed in C++ using Qt and VTK, providing visualization capabilities for medical imaging data.

tools.name: dicomweb-wsi-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web viewer for Whole Slide Imaging (WSI) via DICOMweb
tools.detailed_description: A proof-of-concept web viewer for Whole Slide Imaging (digital pathology) that consumes data via the Google Cloud Healthcare DICOM API.

tools.name: go-dicom-parser
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient DICOM parsing library in Go
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight and efficient library written in Go for parsing and processing DICOM files, suitable for high-performance data ingestion pipelines.

tools.name: wsi-to-dicom-converter
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for converting Whole Slide Images to DICOM format
tools.detailed_description: A C++ tool and library for converting various Whole Slide Image (WSI) formats into the standard DICOM format, facilitating interoperability in digital pathology.

tools.name: iSEG
tools.one_line_profile: Fully integrated medical image segmentation toolbox
tools.detailed_description: The Medical Image Segmentation Tool Set (iSEG) is a fully integrated segmentation toolbox (including pre- and postprocessing) for the efficient, fast, and flexible generation of anatomical models from various types of imaging data.

tools.name: ImagePy
tools.one_line_profile: Image processing framework based on plugin architecture
tools.detailed_description: Image process framework based on plugin architecture like ImageJ. It is designed to be easy to glue with scipy.ndimage, scikit-image, opencv, simpleitk, mayavi, and other numpy-based libraries.

tools.name: dicom-microscopy-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM slide microscopy viewer library
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for viewing DICOM Slide Microscopy objects in web browsers, supporting visualization of whole slide images.

tools.name: dicomweb-client
tools.one_line_profile: Python client for DICOMweb RESTful services
tools.detailed_description: A Python client library for interacting with DICOMweb RESTful services, enabling search, retrieval, and storage of DICOM objects.

tools.name: highdicom
tools.one_line_profile: High-level DICOM abstractions for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing high-level abstractions for creating and handling DICOM objects, simplifying the creation of complex DICOM IODs like Structured Reports and Segmentation.

tools.name: libdicom
tools.one_line_profile: C library for reading DICOM files
tools.detailed_description: A C library designed for reading DICOM files, providing low-level access to DICOM data structures.

tools.name: slim
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM slide microscopy viewer and annotation tool
tools.detailed_description: An interoperable web-based viewer and annotation tool for DICOM slide microscopy, facilitating the visualization and labeling of whole slide images.

tools.name: jsdicom
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM library and viewer in JavaScript
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library and viewer for handling and visualizing DICOM images in web environments.

tools.name: jsdicom-lib
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM library in JavaScript
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for parsing and manipulating DICOM data.

tools.name: simpleITK-Snap
tools.one_line_profile: Qt-based 3D data visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A 3D data visualization tool built with Qt and SimpleITK, designed for viewing medical imaging data.

tools.name: MedEye3d.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for medical image visualization and annotation
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for visualization and annotation of medical images, specialized for rapid development of segmentation for 3D images like CT or PET/CT scans.

tools.name: VolView
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based 3D radiological viewer
tools.detailed_description: A 3D radiological viewer that runs in the browser, supporting DICOM, volume rendering, and annotations, ensuring data privacy by keeping data on the client side.

tools.name: ITKPOCUS
tools.one_line_profile: Library for point-of-care ultrasound video processing
tools.detailed_description: An open source library for streaming and preprocessing point-of-care ultrasound (POCUS) video data.

tools.name: SlicerNNUnet
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for nnUNet integration
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension that integrates nnUNet to streamline the usage of nnUNet-based AI segmentation models within the Slicer environment.

tools.name: dicom-anonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to anonymize DICOM files
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to anonymize DICOM files according to the DICOM standard, ensuring patient privacy.

tools.name: dicom-exporter
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM file converter in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility for converting DICOM files, facilitating data interoperability.

tools.name: MEDIAR
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-Modality Microscopy Segmentation Framework
tools.detailed_description: A general medical image segmentation framework that harmonizes data-centric and model-centric approaches, winner of the NeurIPS 2022 CellSeg Challenge.

tools.name: copper3d_visualisation
tools.one_line_profile: 3D visualisation package based on Three.js
tools.detailed_description: A 3D visualisation package providing DICOM loading, NRRD segmentation tools, and GLTF export capabilities, built on Three.js.

tools.name: dicom-fhir-converter
tools.one_line_profile: Converts DICOM Resources to FHIR Resources
tools.detailed_description: A tool for converting DICOM metadata and resources into FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) format to support interoperability.

tools.name: DicomVis
tools.one_line_profile: Simple DICOM series viewer
tools.detailed_description: A simple 4-pane viewer for visualising series of DICOM images, written in Python using VTK.

tools.name: fastMONAI
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper library simplifying MONAI for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A library that simplifies deep learning for medical imaging by wrapping MONAI functionalities, making it easier to develop and train models.

tools.name: MedLabelMe
tools.one_line_profile: Segmentation annotation tool for 3D medical images
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight tool designed for annotating 3D medical images for segmentation tasks, facilitating the creation of ground truth datasets.

tools.name: Pytorch-Medical-Segmentation
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of PyTorch implementations for medical image segmentation models
tools.detailed_description: A repository providing implementations of various popular deep learning architectures (U-Net, V-Net, etc.) specifically adapted for 2D and 3D medical image segmentation tasks.

tools.name: NBIA
tools.one_line_profile: National Biomedical Imaging Archive software for medical image storage and retrieval
tools.detailed_description: A software application enabling users to securely store, search, and download diagnostic medical images, integrating in vivo cancer images with clinical and genomic data.

tools.name: MONAI Cloud API
tools.one_line_profile: Cloud API interfaces for MONAI imaging and learning tools
tools.detailed_description: Provides API developments to access MONAI's intelligent imaging and learning tools over the cloud, fostering innovation in AI-driven medical imaging services.

tools.name: OHIF Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Extensible web-based medical image viewer and oncology lesion tracker
tools.detailed_description: A zero-footprint DICOM viewer and oncology-specific Lesion Tracker. It serves as a platform for viewing, annotating, and analyzing medical images in research and clinical contexts.

tools.name: dicom-dimse
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for DICOM DIMSE networking
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing the DICOM DIMSE (DICOM Message Service Element) protocol, enabling medical imaging applications to communicate with PACS and other DICOM nodes.

tools.name: MedicalSeg
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end 3D medical image segmentation toolkit based on PaddlePaddle
tools.detailed_description: An easy-to-use toolkit supporting the whole 3D medical image segmentation process, including data preprocessing acceleration, high-precision models, and 3D visualization.

tools.name: dcmjs-dimse
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM DIMSE implementation for Node.js using dcmjs
tools.detailed_description: Provides DICOM networking capabilities for Node.js applications, allowing integration with medical imaging infrastructure via the DIMSE protocol.

tools.name: dcmjs-imaging
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM image and overlay rendering pipeline for Node.js and browser
tools.detailed_description: A rendering pipeline using dcmjs to visualize DICOM images and overlays, suitable for web-based medical imaging applications.

tools.name: MONAI Generative Models
tools.one_line_profile: Generative models toolkit for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A MONAI extension that facilitates training, evaluating, and deploying generative models (GANs, Diffusion Models) specifically for medical imaging applications like synthesis and augmentation.

tools.name: MONAI
tools.one_line_profile: AI Toolkit for Healthcare Imaging
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based, open-source framework for deep learning in healthcare imaging, providing domain-optimized foundational capabilities for developing medical AI workflows.

tools.name: MONAI Label
tools.one_line_profile: Intelligent open source image labeling and learning tool
tools.detailed_description: A server-client system that facilitates AI-assisted annotation of medical imaging data, integrating active learning to accelerate the creation of labeled datasets.

tools.name: SlicerMONAIViz
tools.one_line_profile: MONAI visualization extension for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension that integrates MONAI capabilities, allowing users to run MONAI models and visualize results directly within the Slicer environment.

tools.name: MONAI VISTA
tools.one_line_profile: Versatile Imaging Segmentation and Annotation foundation model
tools.detailed_description: A framework and model for versatile imaging segmentation and annotation, designed to handle various medical imaging tasks using foundation model approaches.

tools.name: MONAI Model Zoo
tools.one_line_profile: Repository of pre-trained medical imaging models in MONAI Bundle format
tools.detailed_description: Hosts a collection of pre-trained models for various medical imaging tasks (segmentation, classification) packaged as MONAI Bundles for easy use and deployment.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for developing and deploying medical AI applications
tools.detailed_description: A framework aiming to standardize the development, packaging, testing, and deployment of medical AI applications in clinical production environments.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy App SDK
tools.one_line_profile: SDK for designing and developing AI-driven healthcare imaging applications
tools.detailed_description: Offers tools and a framework to design, develop, and verify AI applications (MAPs) for healthcare imaging, facilitating their deployment via MONAI Deploy.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy Informatics Gateway
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM integration gateway for MONAI Deploy
tools.detailed_description: Facilitates integration with DICOM systems, enabling imaging data ingestion, workflow triggering, and result pushing to PACS within the MONAI Deploy ecosystem.

tools.name: MONAI Research Contributions
tools.one_line_profile: Implementations of research prototypes using MONAI
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing implementations of state-of-the-art research papers and prototypes built with MONAI, serving as a reference library for advanced medical imaging methods.

tools.name: dcmqi
tools.one_line_profile: Library for converting imaging research formats to DICOM
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library (DICOM for Quantitative Imaging) that supports the conversion of image analysis results (segmentations, measurements) from research formats into standard DICOM objects.

tools.name: medio
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for medical image I/O
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to simplify the input/output operations for medical images, handling various formats and metadata.

tools.name: RSNA DICOM Anonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for anonymizing DICOM files
tools.detailed_description: A tool provided by the RSNA for removing protected health information (PHI) from DICOM files to ensure patient privacy in research datasets.

tools.name: SimpleITK
tools.one_line_profile: Simplified interface to the Insight Toolkit (ITK) for medical image analysis
tools.detailed_description: SimpleITK provides a simplified interface to ITK, facilitating image analysis, segmentation, and registration in multiple languages including Python and R.

tools.name: SlicerJupyter
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of 3D Slicer with Jupyter notebooks
tools.detailed_description: An extension for 3D Slicer that enables the use of the application and its medical imaging modules directly from Jupyter notebooks.

tools.name: SlicerLungCTAnalyzer
tools.one_line_profile: Lung CT segmentation and analysis extension for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension designed for the segmentation and spatial reconstruction of infiltrated, collapsed, and emphysematous areas in lung CT scans.

tools.name: SlicerDMRI
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion MRI analysis and visualization platform
tools.detailed_description: An extension for 3D Slicer providing tools for diffusion MRI analysis, tractography, and visualization.

tools.name: SlicerHeart
tools.one_line_profile: Cardiac analysis extension for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools for cardiac image analysis within 3D Slicer, supporting various modalities and structural assessments.

tools.name: SlicerIGT
tools.one_line_profile: Image-guided therapy tools for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: Modules supporting image-guided interventions, tracking, and navigation in 3D Slicer.

tools.name: SlicerMorph
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric morphometrics toolkit for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: An extension to import microCT data and conduct 3D geometric morphometrics analysis within Slicer.

tools.name: SlicerRT
tools.one_line_profile: Radiation therapy research toolkit for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: Open-source toolkit for radiation therapy research, featuring DICOM-RT import/export, dose volume histograms, and external beam planning.

tools.name: SimpleElastix
tools.one_line_profile: Medical image registration library
tools.detailed_description: A multi-lingual medical image registration library that extends SimpleITK with the Elastix registration framework.

tools.name: prostatecancer.ai
tools.one_line_profile: AI-based medical image viewer for prostate cancer detection
tools.detailed_description: A zero-footprint medical image viewer integrated with AI models to identify clinically significant prostate cancer from imaging data.

tools.name: TorchIO
tools.one_line_profile: Medical imaging processing for deep learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for efficient loading, preprocessing, augmentation, and patch-based sampling of medical images for deep learning applications.

tools.name: Dcm2Bids
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM to BIDS converter
tools.detailed_description: A tool to reorganize NIfTI files generated by dcm2niix into the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS).

tools.name: dicom2mesh
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM/NIfTI to 3D mesh converter
tools.detailed_description: A utility to generate 3D meshes (.obj) from DICOM or NIfTI image stacks using the marching cubes algorithm.

tools.name: WillowbendDICOM
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM to video converter
tools.detailed_description: A dialog-based utility to convert DICOM image series into video formats.

tools.name: STitch3D
tools.one_line_profile: 3D whole organism spatial atlas construction
tools.detailed_description: A tool for constructing 3D whole organism spatial atlases by jointly modeling multiple tissue slices.

tools.name: pdf2dcm
tools.one_line_profile: PDF to DICOM conversion library
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to convert PDF documents into DICOM format, facilitating the integration of reports into medical imaging workflows.

tools.name: DICAT
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM header anonymization tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool specifically designed to anonymize DICOM data headers for privacy protection in research datasets.

tools.name: LinaQA
tools.one_line_profile: Medical physics toolkit for radiotherapy QA
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for quality assurance in radiotherapy, diagnostic radiology, and nuclear medicine, built on pylinac and pydicom.

tools.name: medicat
tools.one_line_profile: Dataset of medical images and captions
tools.detailed_description: A large-scale dataset containing medical images, captions, subfigure-subcaption annotations, and inline textual references for research.

tools.name: pydcmview
tools.one_line_profile: Terminal-based viewer for DICOM, NRRD, and NIfTI medical images
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, terminal-based image viewer designed for quick inspection of medical imaging formats like DICOM, NRRD, and NIfTI directly from the command line.

tools.name: Medical-Data-Visualization-3D
tools.one_line_profile: Standalone C++ program for 3D visualization of medical DICOM/MRI/CT data
tools.detailed_description: A C++ application for visualizing medical datasets (DICOM, MRI, CT) in 3D, including features for image scrolling, segmentation, and 3D model generation for brain and bone structures.

tools.name: Nextcloud DICOM Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer integration for the Nextcloud platform
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Nextcloud that enables users to view and manipulate DICOM medical images directly within the Nextcloud web interface, facilitating secure sharing and review of medical data.

tools.name: dicompyler
tools.one_line_profile: Extensible radiation therapy research platform and DICOM RT viewer
tools.detailed_description: An extensible open-source platform for radiation therapy research, serving as a viewer for DICOM and DICOM RT data, allowing analysis of dose volume histograms (DVH) and other radiotherapy metrics.

tools.name: rocket_viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Generic viewer for medical images, 3D surfaces, and biological signals
tools.detailed_description: A versatile viewer developed by BCN MedTech for visualizing various types of biomedical data, including medical images, 3D surface meshes, and electric signals like ECGs.

tools.name: SAMM (Segment Anything Model for Medical)
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension integrating Meta's Segment Anything Model (SAM)
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension that integrates Meta's Segment Anything Model (SAM) to assist in the segmentation of medical images, allowing for interactive and automated segmentation workflows within Slicer.

tools.name: dicognito
tools.one_line_profile: Library and CLI tool for anonymizing DICOM files
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and command-line tool designed to anonymize DICOM files by removing or replacing patient-identifying information, ensuring data privacy for research and sharing.

tools.name: MedSAMSlicer
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer plugin for Segment Anything in Medical Images (MedSAM)
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer plugin that integrates MedSAM (Segment Anything Model adapted for medical images), enabling efficient and accurate segmentation of medical images within the Slicer environment.

tools.name: Dicom_RT_and_Images_to_Mask
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for converting DICOM images and RT structures to Python objects
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that facilitates the conversion of DICOM images, RT Structure Sets, and Dose files into NumPy arrays and SimpleITK images, streamlining the preprocessing pipeline for radiotherapy research.

tools.name: dicom-anon
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based DICOM anonymization tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool developed by CHOP (Children's Hospital of Philadelphia) for anonymizing DICOM files, adhering to safe harbor standards for de-identification of medical imaging data.

tools.name: dicom-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Automated pipeline for reviewing and anonymizing research DICOM studies
tools.detailed_description: An automated pipeline tool from CHOP for managing the workflow of reviewing, anonymizing, and publishing DICOM studies for research purposes.

tools.name: StudyCentric
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based research DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based DICOM viewer developed by CHOP specifically for research contexts, allowing for the visualization and review of medical imaging studies.

tools.name: SlicerNNInteractive
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for interactive segmentation with nnInteractive
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension that implements nnInteractive, enabling efficient, interactive deep learning-based segmentation of medical images directly within the Slicer interface.

tools.name: calculate-suv
tools.one_line_profile: Library for calculating Standardized Uptake Value (SUV) for PET/SPECT
tools.detailed_description: A specialized JavaScript/TypeScript library for calculating Standardized Uptake Values (SUV) from Nuclear Medicine data (PET/SPECT), essential for quantitative analysis in medical imaging.

tools.name: Cornerstone3D
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for building interactive 3D medical imaging applications
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive JavaScript library for rendering and interacting with 3D medical images in web browsers. It serves as the core rendering engine for many web-based radiology viewers and research tools.

tools.name: ASCENT
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for cardiac ultrasound segmentation and color-Doppler dealiasing
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox (ASCENT) designed for the processing of cardiac ultrasound data, specifically offering tools for segmentation and dealiasing of color-Doppler images.

tools.name: DVH-Analytics
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM database and analysis application for radiation oncology
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application for building a local database of DICOM radiation therapy data, enabling population-based analysis of Dose Volume Histograms (DVH) and treatment plans.

tools.name: BlueLight
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight browser-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A pure JavaScript, browser-based DICOM viewer that requires no backend installation, providing a lightweight solution for viewing medical images on various devices.

tools.name: Databricks Pixels
tools.one_line_profile: Library for processing medical images and documents on Databricks
tools.detailed_description: A library from Databricks Industry Solutions designed to facilitate large-scale processing of medical images (DICOM), documents, and other unstructured data within the Databricks Lakehouse platform.

tools.name: dicom2stl
tools.one_line_profile: Script to extract STL surfaces from DICOM image series
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that converts DICOM image series into STL surface meshes, enabling 3D printing and biomedical engineering applications from medical scan data.

tools.name: SALMON
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning segmentation software based on MONAI
tools.detailed_description: SALMON (Segmentation ALgorithm based on MONai) is a software package for single and multi-label segmentation of 3D medical images, built upon the MONAI framework.

tools.name: ECVL
tools.one_line_profile: European Computer Vision Library for healthcare applications
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose computer vision library developed under the DeepHealth project, specifically optimized for healthcare use cases and integration of medical imaging workflows.

tools.name: brainload
tools.one_line_profile: Python module for accessing FreeSurfer brain surface and morphometry data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to facilitate the loading and parsing of FreeSurfer brain surface meshes and morphometry data files, reducing the complexity of handling these specific neuroimaging formats.

tools.name: MONAILabel-Apps
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of domain-specific applications for MONAI Label
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing a zoo of applications (radiology, pathology, etc.) for MONAI Label, providing pre-configured models and active learning strategies for medical image annotation tasks.

tools.name: ruby-dicom
tools.one_line_profile: Ruby library for handling DICOM files and network communication
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Ruby library for reading, editing, and writing DICOM files, as well as handling DICOM network communication (SCP/SCU).

tools.name: dicompyler-core
tools.one_line_profile: Core radiation therapy modules for DICOM RT
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing core functionality for handling DICOM RT (Radiation Therapy) objects, including structures, doses, and plans, serving as the foundation for the dicompyler application.

tools.name: TriDFusion
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB-based medical imaging viewer and fusion tool
tools.detailed_description: A medical imaging viewer and fusion software written in MATLAB, supporting DICOM and other formats for 3D visualization and image analysis.

tools.name: OnkoDICOM
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM RT research platform for radiation oncology
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, cross-platform software designed for Radiation Oncologists to research DICOM standard image sets (DICOM-RT, CT, MRI, PET), leveraging technologies like pydicom and dicompyler-core.

tools.name: dcmpandas
tools.one_line_profile: Library for loading DICOM datasets into Pandas DataFrames
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility library that facilitates the loading of DICOM directories and metadata into Pandas DataFrames, enabling tabular analysis of medical image datasets.

tools.name: pyslm
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for 3D printing and additive manufacturing
tools.detailed_description: A library for generating and processing data for Additive Manufacturing (3D Printing), specifically Selective Laser Melting (SLM), including slicing and hatching algorithms.

tools.name: obj2voxel
tools.one_line_profile: Command-line tool to convert OBJ/STL meshes to voxels
tools.detailed_description: A fast C++ tool for converting 3D mesh files (OBJ, STL) into voxel representations, useful for geometry processing and simulation setup.

tools.name: spycer
tools.one_line_profile: G-code viewer for 5-axis 3D printing
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool for viewing G-code paths generated for 5-axis 3D printers, aiding in the verification of manufacturing processes.

tools.name: DicomBrowser
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight portable DICOM browser application
tools.detailed_description: A portable Python-based application for browsing and inspecting DICOM files and their metadata.

tools.name: 3DCurator
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Viewer for CT scans of cultural heritage objects
tools.detailed_description: A specialized 3D viewer designed for analyzing CT scans of polychromed wood sculptures, supporting specific visualization needs in cultural heritage science.

tools.name: SlicerTomoSAM
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension using Segment Anything Model (SAM)
tools.detailed_description: An extension for 3D Slicer that integrates the Segment Anything Model (SAM) to assist in the segmentation of 3D tomography data.

tools.name: SlicerTorchIO
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer module for TorchIO integration
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer module that provides an interface to TorchIO, enabling data augmentation and preprocessing workflows directly within Slicer.

tools.name: mDCM
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM library for C#
tools.detailed_description: A C# library for handling DICOM files and communication, serving as a foundation for .NET based medical imaging applications.

tools.name: slicer
tools.one_line_profile: Fast 3D mesh slicer library
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance library written in Go for slicing 3D meshes, useful for 3D printing preparation and computational geometry tasks.

tools.name: SL1toPhoton
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for 3D printing file formats (SL1 to Photon)
tools.detailed_description: A utility tool to convert SL1 3D printing files to Photon format, facilitating interoperability between different 3D printer ecosystems.

tools.name: GalaxySlicer
tools.one_line_profile: G-code generator for 3D printers
tools.detailed_description: A slicing software that generates G-code for various 3D printers, supporting the translation of 3D models into manufacturing instructions.

tools.name: dicomgraphics
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM graphics viewer and utility applications
tools.detailed_description: A set of applications and libraries for viewing and manipulating DICOM graphics, built with Go.

tools.name: SlicerDentalSegmentator
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for dental CT segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension designed for the fully automatic segmentation of teeth and jaws from CT and CBCT dental volumes.

tools.name: ginkgocadx
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced open-source DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform DICOM viewer and PACS workstation, providing advanced visualization and diagnostic tools for medical imaging professionals.

tools.name: gsSlicer
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source 3D printing slicer
tools.detailed_description: A 3D printing slicer application written in C#, capable of generating instructions for additive manufacturing from 3D models.

tools.name: go-netdicom
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM network protocol library for Go
tools.detailed_description: A Golang implementation of the DICOM network protocol, enabling the creation of DICOM service class providers (SCP) and users (SCU).

tools.name: napari-simpleitk-image-processing
tools.one_line_profile: Napari plugin for SimpleITK image processing
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the napari viewer that exposes SimpleITK image processing functions, allowing users to apply filters and transformations directly within the viewer.

tools.name: MedicalViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Desktop DICOM viewer using Qt, ITK, and VTK
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application for 2D and 3D visualization of DICOM images, built using the Qt framework and scientific libraries ITK and VTK.

tools.name: SlicerBatchAnonymize
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for batch DICOM anonymization
tools.detailed_description: An extension for 3D Slicer that enables the batch anonymization of DICOM images, a critical step for data sharing and privacy in medical research.

tools.name: imageio
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for reading and writing image data including scientific formats
tools.detailed_description: Imageio is a Python library that provides an easy interface to read and write a wide range of image data, including animated images, volumetric data, and scientific formats like DICOM and TIFF.

tools.name: wsidicomizer
tools.one_line_profile: Library for converting Whole Slide Imaging (WSI) files to DICOM
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to convert various Whole Slide Image (WSI) formats into standard DICOM format, facilitating interoperability in digital pathology workflows.

tools.name: DICOMClient
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for anonymizing, viewing, and uploading DICOM files to PACS
tools.detailed_description: A set of Java-based utilities designed for clinical workflows, enabling users to anonymize DICOM data, view images, and upload them to Picture Archiving and Communication Systems (PACS).

tools.name: zViewer
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer based on DCMTK and OpenGL
tools.detailed_description: A C++ based DICOM viewer application utilizing DCMTK for DICOM handling and OpenGL for rendering, providing PACS connectivity and image review capabilities.

tools.name: dwv
tools.one_line_profile: Zero footprint DICOM Web Viewer library
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for parsing and displaying DICOM images in web browsers, enabling the creation of zero-footprint medical image viewers.

tools.name: pydiq
tools.one_line_profile: Simple DICOM browser and viewer in Python
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python application for browsing and viewing DICOM files, built on top of pydicom and PyQt.

tools.name: medview
tools.one_line_profile: HTML5/Javascript based DICOM image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based medical image viewer supporting DICOM format, implemented in HTML5 and JavaScript for browser-based visualization.

tools.name: dicomweb-proxy
tools.one_line_profile: Proxy to translate between DICOMWeb and DIMSE services
tools.detailed_description: A middleware tool that acts as a proxy to translate requests between modern DICOMWeb standards and traditional DICOM DIMSE services, facilitating integration with legacy PACS.

tools.name: dicomifier
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for converting DICOM data to NIfTI and HDF5 formats
tools.detailed_description: Dicomifier is a set of tools and libraries to convert DICOM series into NIfTI or HDF5 files, aiming to preserve metadata and structure during conversion.

tools.name: odil
tools.one_line_profile: C++11 library for the DICOM standard
tools.detailed_description: Odil is a C++ library that provides a comprehensive implementation of the DICOM standard, supporting various protocols and data structures for medical imaging applications.

tools.name: SlicerMONAIAuto3DSeg
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for running MONAI Auto3DSeg models
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the 3D Slicer platform that integrates MONAI's Auto3DSeg functionality, allowing users to run automated 3D segmentation models directly within the Slicer environment.

tools.name: SlicerTotalSegmentator
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for fully automatic total body segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension that wraps the TotalSegmentator AI model, enabling fully automatic segmentation of anatomical structures in whole-body CT scans.

tools.name: PreProcPipe
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for medical image preprocessing with LLM automation
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline tool designed to automate the preprocessing of medical images, incorporating Large Language Model (LLM) capabilities to streamline workflow configuration and execution.

tools.name: medpy
tools.one_line_profile: Library for medical image processing in Python
tools.detailed_description: MedPy is an open-source library for medical image processing in Python, providing basic functionalities for reading, writing, and manipulating high-dimensional medical image data.

tools.name: dicom-ecg-plot
tools.one_line_profile: Viewer and converter for DICOM ECG data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to read, plot, and convert DICOM ECG waveforms into various image formats (PDF, PNG, SVG), facilitating the visualization and sharing of electrocardiogram data.

tools.name: OCT-Converter
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for extracting raw OCT and fundus data from proprietary formats
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for extracting raw Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) and fundus image data from various proprietary manufacturer file formats, enabling research access to raw data.

tools.name: SlicerSegmentWithSAM
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension integrating Segment Anything Model (SAM) for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension that enables users to use Meta's Segment Anything Model (SAM) directly within the Slicer environment for efficient medical image segmentation.

tools.name: webDICOM
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer for medical image visualization
tools.detailed_description: A web-based viewer for DICOM files, allowing users to visualize medical images directly in a browser environment.

tools.name: InnerEye-CreateDataset
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to transform DICOM data into masks for deep learning training
tools.detailed_description: A dataset creation tool designed for the InnerEye-DeepLearning library that converts DICOM data into NIfTI masks suitable for training deep learning models.

tools.name: dicom.el
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer for Emacs
tools.detailed_description: A DICOM viewer implementation for the Emacs text editor, allowing users to view medical images within the Emacs environment.

tools.name: Physics-ArX
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based data augmentation library for CT and CBCT images
tools.detailed_description: A library for physics-based data augmentation specifically designed for quantifying CT and CBCT images in radiotherapy, supporting robust model training.

tools.name: nibabel
tools.one_line_profile: Library to access neuro-imaging file formats
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package to provide read and write access to some common medical and neuroimaging file formats, including NIfTI1, NIfTI2, MINC1, MINC2, and others.

tools.name: nitransforms
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric transformations for neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: A library for handling geometric transformations in neuroimaging, allowing for the manipulation and application of spatial transforms to medical images.

tools.name: neuropythy
tools.one_line_profile: Neuroscience library for Python complementing nibabel
tools.detailed_description: A Python library dedicated to neuroscience research, designed to work alongside nibabel for analyzing and processing neuroimaging data, particularly for cortical surface analysis.

tools.name: Weasis
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer for advanced medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive web-based DICOM viewer that integrates with PACS systems, offering advanced visualization tools for medical imaging analysis.

tools.name: STU-Net
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale pre-trained medical image segmentation model
tools.detailed_description: A large-scale pre-trained model (1.4B parameters) for medical image segmentation, trained on a massive collection of public datasets, offering state-of-the-art performance.

tools.name: PET2BIDS
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to convert PET data into BIDS format
tools.detailed_description: A utility library and command-line tool to convert raw PET scanner files (e.g., ECAT, DICOM) into the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS) standard.

tools.name: Aeskulap
tools.one_line_profile: Medical image viewer and DICOM network client
tools.detailed_description: An open-source medical image viewer capable of loading a series of special images stored in DICOM format and querying PACS servers.

tools.name: OsiriX
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced DICOM viewer for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A widely used DICOM viewer for MacOS, providing advanced visualization, processing, and analysis capabilities for medical images.

tools.name: OsiriX Plugins
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of plugins for OsiriX DICOM Viewer
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing various plugins to extend the functionality of the OsiriX DICOM viewer, enabling custom processing and analysis workflows.

tools.name: Vega
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for reading, writing, and editing DICOM files
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library designed for efficient reading, writing, and editing of DICOM files, facilitating medical image data manipulation.

tools.name: contrib-pydicom
tools.one_line_profile: Community contributions and plugins for pydicom
tools.detailed_description: A collection of community-contributed plugins, tutorials, and extensions for the pydicom library, enhancing its capabilities for DICOM data handling.

tools.name: deid
tools.one_line_profile: Best effort anonymization for medical images
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for de-identifying (anonymizing) medical images, particularly DICOM files, to support privacy-compliant research and data sharing.

tools.name: pydicom
tools.one_line_profile: A pure Python package for working with DICOM files
tools.detailed_description: pydicom is a pure Python package for parsing and modifying DICOM files. It allows easy reading and writing of DICOM data elements and is a foundational library for medical image processing in Python.

tools.name: pylibjpeg
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for decoding JPEG images with DICOM support
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for decoding JPEG images, specifically designed to support the various JPEG transfer syntaxes used in DICOM medical imaging data.

tools.name: pynetdicom
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of the DICOM networking protocol
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the DICOM networking protocol (Service Class User and Service Class Provider). It allows users to create DICOM applications that can query, retrieve, and send medical images.

tools.name: pymedphys
tools.one_line_profile: Open standard library for Medical Physics
tools.detailed_description: A community-driven open-source library for Medical Physics, providing tools for quality assurance, DICOM manipulation, dosimetry, and gamma analysis.

tools.name: ITK-SNAP
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive software for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A software application used to segment structures in 3D medical images. It provides semi-automatic segmentation using active contour methods as well as manual delineation and image navigation.

tools.name: cuda_spatial_deform
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated image augmentation for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A fast CUDA-based tool for performing spatial deformations (elastic deformation) on medical images, primarily used for data augmentation in deep learning pipelines.

tools.name: rt-utils
tools.one_line_profile: Library for creating and manipulating DICOM RTStructs
tools.detailed_description: A minimal Python library designed to facilitate the creation, manipulation, and conversion of DICOM RTStruct (Radiotherapy Structure Set) files, often used for segmentation masks in radiotherapy.

tools.name: pydicom-seg
tools.one_line_profile: Library for DICOM-SEG reading and writing
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for reading and writing DICOM-SEG (Segmentation) objects, bridging the gap between DICOM standards and scientific computing arrays (numpy).

tools.name: Evil-DICOM
tools.one_line_profile: C# DICOM Library
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight C# library for reading, manipulating, and writing DICOM files, serving as a .NET alternative for DICOM processing.

tools.name: dcm2niix
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM to NIfTI converter
tools.detailed_description: A robust and widely used tool for converting medical images from DICOM format to NIfTI format, preserving BIDS-compatible metadata (JSON sidecars). Essential for neuroimaging and general medical image analysis pipelines.

tools.name: CheXbert
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic radiology report labeler using BERT
tools.detailed_description: A BERT-based model and tool for automatically extracting structured labels (presence of observations) from radiology reports, achieving performance comparable to expert radiologists.

tools.name: Starviewer
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform medical imaging software
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform open-source medical imaging software dedicated to DICOM image viewing, navigation, and analysis, supporting various modalities and providing advanced visualization tools.

tools.name: arc-overhang
tools.one_line_profile: 3D printer slicing algorithm for printing 90° overhangs without support
tools.detailed_description: A 3D printer slicing algorithm that enables printing of 90° overhangs without support material by using arc movements.

tools.name: radiomics-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Image processing tools for radiomics analysis
tools.detailed_description: A collection of image processing tools designed for radiomics analysis, facilitating feature extraction from medical images.

tools.name: WSI-analysis
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Whole-Slide Image (WSI) preprocessing scripts
tools.detailed_description: Python scripts for automatic preprocessing of Whole-Slide Images (WSI), useful for pathology image analysis pipelines.

tools.name: dicom-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: 3D medical dataset viewer
tools.detailed_description: A tool for viewing medical datasets in 3D, supporting DICOM formats.

tools.name: VR-DICOM-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Virtual Reality DICOM viewer for CT scans
tools.detailed_description: A Virtual Reality project designed for interacting with DICOM data, specifically from CT scanned fractures.

tools.name: dicomsdl
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM Software Development Library
tools.detailed_description: A library for developing software that interacts with DICOM files, providing low-level access and manipulation capabilities.

tools.name: STU-Net
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale pre-trained medical image segmentation model
tools.detailed_description: The largest pre-trained medical image segmentation model (1.4B parameters) based on a massive public dataset, enabling high-performance segmentation tasks.

tools.name: SliceBeam
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Model slicer for Android devices
tools.detailed_description: A mobile application for slicing 3D models directly on Android devices, facilitating 3D printing workflows.

tools.name: BoostMIS
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-supervised medical image segmentation with adaptive pseudo labeling
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of BoostMIS, a method for boosting medical image semi-supervised learning using adaptive pseudo labeling and informative active annotation.

tools.name: u-dicom-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A simple and accessible web browser-based DICOM viewer compatible with various devices.

tools.name: Dicom-Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: 2D/3D DICOM display application
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based application for displaying and interacting with 2D and 3D DICOM medical images.

tools.name: brainstorm
tools.one_line_profile: Data augmentation using learned transforms for one-shot segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing data augmentation techniques using learned transforms, specifically designed for one-shot medical image segmentation tasks.

tools.name: Slice3D
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-slice single view 3D reconstruction tool
tools.detailed_description: Slice3D performs multi-slice, occlusion-revealing, single-view 3D reconstruction, useful for recovering 3D structures from limited views.

tools.name: dicom2jpg
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM to image format converter
tools.detailed_description: A simple Python tool to convert DICOM files into common image formats (jpg, png, bmp, tiff) and numpy arrays for analysis.

tools.name: S3_DeformFDM
tools.one_line_profile: General slicing framework for multi-axis 3D printing
tools.detailed_description: S^3-Slicer is a general slicing framework designed for multi-axis 3D printing, enabling complex fabrication tasks.

tools.name: ImageViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Simple C# DICOM image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A simple DICOM image viewer control implemented in C#, suitable for embedding in applications or simple viewing tasks.

tools.name: Patho-GAN
tools.one_line_profile: GAN for retinal image generation and augmentation
tools.detailed_description: Patho-GAN provides tools for explainable diabetic retinopathy detection and retinal image generation (augmentation) using Generative Adversarial Networks.

tools.name: Dual-Normalization
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-modality medical image segmentation tool
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a generalizable cross-modality medical image segmentation method using style augmentation and dual normalization.
